title: Indian PM Modi calls deadly Delhi blast ‘conspiracy’
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday (Nov 11) called a deadly car explosion in the heart of the capital a “conspiracy”, vowing those responsible will face justice.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at most parts of the island after 1.00 p.m, today (12), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Six arrested with 300kg of narcotics in Kirinda
byline: Six individuals have been arrested with 300 kilograms of narcotic substances in Kirinda by the Western Province North Crimes Range and a team from the Southern Province Police, police said.

title: No threat to Sri Lanka from blasts in India and Pakistan – Minister Wijepala
byline: Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala claims that there is no security threat to Sri Lanka from the recent explosions that occurred in India and Pakistan.

title: Former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga arrested
byline: Former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga arrives at Bribery Comission
byline: Former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga has arrived at the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), a short while ago.

title: Sri Lanka and Saudi Arabia sign MoU to form joint business council
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism Vijitha Herath announced the establishment of the historic Sri Lanka–Saudi Arabia Joint Business Council, marking a significant milestone in strengthening economic relations between the two nations.

title: SJB’s Sameera Dhanushka appointed to Weligama PS following chairman’s death
byline: An Extraordinary Gazette notification has been issued announcing the appointment of Sameera Dhanushka De Silva of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) as a member of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, representing Ward No. 07, Midigama West.

title: Apple is selling a $230 iPhone pocket inspired by a ‘piece of cloth’
byline: The tech giant is getting in on the trend of people wearing their phones and tapping a luxury fashion brand for its latest collaboration. Apple plans to release this week a special-edition iPhone pocket designed in collaboration with the high-end Japanese brand Issey Miyake.

title: Squid Game star, 81, acquitted of sexual misconduct
byline: Squid Game star O Yeong-Su has been acquitted of sexual misconduct charges by a court in South Korea.

title: Protesters force their way into COP30 summit venue, clash with security
byline: Dozens of Indigenous protesters forced their way into the COP30 climate summit venue on Tuesday and clashed with security guards at the entrance to demand climate action and forest protection.

title: Sri Lanka and Latvia sign agreement on transfer of sentenced persons
byline: In a move to strengthen bilateral cooperation in consular and legal affairs, Sri Lanka and Latvia have signed the Agreement on the Transfer of Sentenced Persons at the High Commission of Sri Lanka in New Delhi.

title: US has to bring in talent from around the world: President Trump on H-1B visa
byline: US President Donald Trump appeared to defend the H-1B visa programme, saying America has to bring in talent from around the world as it does not have “certain talents” in the country.

title: ‘Dambulla Thunders’ owner indicted over alleged LPL match-fixing
byline: The owner of the “Dambulla Thunders” franchise, Tamim Rahman was served indictment today (12) before the Colombo High Court for allegedly influencing a cricketer who participated in last year’s Lanka Premier League (LPL) cricket tournament to engage in match-fixing.

title: Insurance scheme for seed paddy production farms
byline: An insurance scheme has been planned to provide coverage for paddy cultivation in seed paddy production farms, the Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board announced.

title: Two suspects including Aava Gang’s leader ‘Vinod’ arrested
byline: Two suspects including ‘Vinod,’ believed to be the leader of the notorious criminal gang operating in the Northern Province, known as ‘Aava Gang’, have been arrested by Chunnakam Police.

title: Thalawa bus accident caused by driver’s negligence, police tell court
byline: The driver of the bus who was arrested and produced before the court over the bus accident that took place near the Jaya Ganga area in Thalawa, which claimed the life of a school student and caused serious and minor injuries to nearly 40 other passengers, has been remanded until November 18 by the Thambuththegama Magistrate’s Court.

title: Former NPP Peliyagoda councillor’s husband remanded
byline: The former National People’s Power (NPP) Peliyagoda Urban Councillor’s husband, who was arrested in Anuradhapura with heroin and subsequently suspended from his position as a school principal in Eppawala, has been remanded until November 26 by the Thambuththegama Magistrate’s Court.

title: Ex-Minister Prasanna Ranatunga produced before court
byline: Former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), has been produced before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (12).
